page.title: 17Holy Rood Church
page.content: The Church is conveniently situated in gently rising ground in the south part of the village. (says Hutchins). There is a tradition among the people that some time ago it formed the central point in the village. New building developments have meant that the church is now on the southern fringe of a rapidly expanding village. The growth of population in recent years means that the 10.00 a.m. Family Eucharist is a lively affair, with young children helping to fill the church. There is a close link between the Church and the Church of England Aided School. The majority of the School governors are members of the Church. The two church wardens and the Rector help to maintain this close link between Church and school.
